title: mail.ru on 32-bit ARM: cannot unmarshal number 111751017437 into Go struct field .body.cloud.space.bytes_used of type int
body:
<!--

We understand you are having a problem with rclone; we want to help you with that!

**STOP and READ**
**YOUR POST WILL BE REMOVED IF IT IS LOW QUALITY**:
Please show the effort you've put into solving the problem and please be specific.
People are volunteering their time to help! Low effort posts are not likely to get good answers!

If you think you might have found a bug, try to replicate it with the latest beta (or stable).
The update instructions are available at https://rclone.org/commands/rclone_selfupdate/

If you can still replicate it or just got a question then please use the rclone forum:

    https://forum.rclone.org/

for a quick response instead of filing an issue on this repo.

If nothing else helps, then please fill in the info below which helps us help you.

**DO NOT REDACT** any information except passwords/keys/personal info.

You should use 3 backticks to begin and end your paste to make it readable.

Make sure to include a log obtained with '-vv'.

You can also use '-vv --log-file bug.log' and a service such as https://pastebin.com or https://gist.github.com/

Thank you

The Rclone Developers

-->

#### What is the problem you are having with rclone?

Command `about` for cloud@mail.ru account fails with following error:
```
Failed to about: About call failed: json: cannot unmarshal number 111751017437 into Go struct field .body.cloud.space.bytes_used of type int
```

#### What is your rclone version (output from `rclone version`)
```
rclone v1.57.0
- os/version: unknown
- os/kernel: 4.2.8 (armv7l)
- os/type: linux
- os/arch: arm
- go/version: go1.17.2
- go/linking: static
- go/tags: none
```

#### Which OS you are using and how many bits (e.g. Windows 7, 64 bit)

QNAP NAS TS-231P  QTS 5.0.0.1932

Note that this is a 32-bit ARM system:

CPU - AnnapurnaLabs, an Amazon company Alpine AL212, 2-core, 1.7GHz
CPU Architecture - 32-bit ARM

#### Which cloud storage system are you using? (e.g. Google Drive)

cloud@mail.ru

#### The command you were trying to run (e.g. `rclone copy /tmp remote:tmp`)

`sudo rclone about mailru: --config /share/CACHEDEV1_DATA/.qpkg/RClone/.config/rclone/rclone.conf`


#### A log from the command with the `-vv` flag (e.g. output from `rclone -vv copy /tmp remote:tmp`)

```
2022/02/20 02:11:42 DEBUG : rclone: Version "v1.57.0" starting with parameters ["rclone" "-vv" "about" "mailru:" "--config" "/share/CACHEDEV1_DATA/.qpkg/RClone/.config/rclone/rclone.conf"]
2022/02/20 02:11:42 DEBUG : Creating backend with remote "mailru:"
2022/02/20 02:11:42 DEBUG : Using config file from "/share/CACHEDEV1_DATA/.qpkg/RClone/.config/rclone/rclone.conf"
2022/02/20 02:11:42 DEBUG : 4 go routines active
2022/02/20 02:11:42 Failed to about: About call failed: json: cannot unmarshal number 111751017437 into Go struct field .body.cloud.space.bytes_used of type int
```

#### Suggestion

From quick code inspection it seems that the problem is in https://github.com/rclone/rclone/blob/v1.57.0/backend/mailru/api/m1.go#L83. Here, type of `BytesUsed` is `int`, while it seems it should be `int64`. (Note that `BytesTotal` is `int64`). If I understand correctly (not fluent in Golang), `int` is platform dependent and probably defautls to (signed) 32-bit on my NAS ARM 32-bit CPU. Since I have ~110GB of data stored in mail.ru cloud, it overflows signed 32-bit int.

<!--- Please keep the note below for others who read your bug report. -->

* Please use the üëç [reaction](https://blog.github.com/2016-03-10-add-reactions-to-pull-requests-issues-and-comments/) to show that you are affected by the same issue.
